name: First Euroflat Hotel

reviews.text: This hotel markets itself as having a fitness suite and a sauna. Ok, on the 8th floor, there's a tiny room (maybe 10 square metres) that takes you back to the 1970s. There is just one mechanical tunturi exercise bike, one very dated multigym and with inches to spare and adjacent to both - a coin fed sunbed. Not that anyone would use it because there is no lock on the "gym" door.
reviews.title: A lousy deal and possibly Belgium's worst gym
Very dated hotel
reviews.text: The sauna on the 6th floor, although it looks alright, also works on a token system, so it's cold when you get there. Here again, there's no lock on the door and the accompanying shower has seethrough glass.

reviews.title: Great value 3.5 stars actually
reviews.text: I'm staying here on a hardly busy Tuesday evening and the price - booked through Eurostar - is just terrible. The room decor might have looked good in the early 1980s.

Nice hotel ,friendly staff. Excellent value for the price. I got a large twin room for the price of a single.The hotel is about 2 km from the city centre so it's quite a walk but there is a metro station beside it (Schuman)...
reviews.title: Great value

reviews.text: Went with a friend to Brussels and had a most pleasing 4-day stay at the Euroflat. I would advise future travellers to get off at the Schuman metro station and leave the station at the exit signposted European Commission. If you leave by one of the other exits, its easy to get lost as all the signposts point the wrong way, and you might end up walking for miles unnecessarily! It is in fact 2 minutes walk (if that) from the metro station. The Schuman metro is on the main line so it only takes about 10 minutes to get to the touristy areas.
reviews.title: Most Pleasing

likes.disliked: — the gym (although didnt want to use it anyway!)

reviews.text: The hotel is, in fact, right opposite the main entrance of the European Commission (if your room looks to the front of the hotel, you will be able to see it from the window). The entrance is very pleasing on the eye, and the reception desk staff very friendly. I am in agreement with other reviewers, the decor, especially in the rooms, is very dated. However, it may be to your taste, and it cant be denied that the whole hotel, including rooms and bathrooms, is spotlessly clean.
reviews.title: very enjoyable
Not 4 star standard
reviews.text: The room did smell of stale cigarette smoke when we first entered (Even though non smoking) but this seemed to disappear after a day of leaving the window open. The rooms are very light as there are very big windows! It wasnt noisy at all, even though there is a busy intersection outside, and there was no noise from inside the hotel. The beds were very comfy, and so a good nights' sleep was had!

I especially enjoyed the kitchenette, also very clean, including a fridge and hobs (you get a second fridge as part of the room). Reception bring cutlery and crockery straight away if you ask for it.. Theres also a dining room. The housekeeping was also very good, especially since we had left washing up in the sink (intending to do it later) and it was all cleared away by the time we returned!
reviews.title: Good value

description: Located in the European Commission district and only at 100m from the Schuman station (metro, bus, trains, airport shuttles), the First Euroflat Hotel welcomes you in the international environment of the European Village.In the classic comfort of its 133 bedrooms, the hotel atmosphere is warm and friendly.The bright and spacious rooms, the generous breakfast and the privileged location of the hotel will place your business trips under the sign of detente.FREE WIFI Hotel
